channel.title: Dark Bow Special
channel.description:
I tried adding the dark bow special to my server (Delta Base), but It always shoots a dragon mace.
[IMG]http://i31.tinypic.com/sowqj8.png[/img]
Anyone know a fix for this, I even tried added it to another base (Non-Delta) and I still received the same results.

item.title: Dark Bow Special
item.dc:creator: @veikron veikron
item.description:
@veikron wrote:

try using silabsoft or something and see what it does

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Bow Special
item.dc:creator: @trytohaxme trytohaxme
item.description:
@trytohaxme wrote:

[quote=“Epic Ancient, post:2, topic:300585”]Change the

projectilespec(###)

= Gfx it’s using to shoot the d-mace. Find out what a good spec looks like.

And btw. It’s a d-mace because, on some clients, d-maces look like d-bow specs in your inventories.
This is why. It’s either your client, or you just have some bad luck.[/quote]

I spawned a dragon mace, and it doesn’t show the dragon head it shows the dragon mace.
All other GFX’s are correct along with the createprojectile.
I don’t really know what else to do, besides remove it because I don’t want it shooting mace’s lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Bow Special
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

CoonHunter:

The model might not be added, the typical model for a d-bow spec is wrote over the dragon mace inventory model. The only suggestion i have is to try finding a client that still has the model in its files.

I have it, yet I have no clue where to get the model anymore. ^^"

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Bow Special
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

The model might not be added, the typical model for a d-bow spec is wrote over the dragon mace inventory model. The only suggestion i have is to try finding a client that still has the model in its files.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Bow Special
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Could be client sided, the gfx class is class23, might wanna check it for any ints where a gfx id is specified, see if it matches the one you used in the server side projectile.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Bow Special
item.dc:creator: @h4x0r88 h4x0r88
item.description:
@h4x0r88 wrote:

AHAHAHAHHAHAHAHHAHAHA that’s fucking EPIC!!!

OH, and by the way the model isn’t added to your clients cache, you have to type
Add model (model number)

^ just a wild guess

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Bow Special
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

trytohaxme:

Hmm… No matter what I seem to do it always ends up with the same results.

Search the Dark bow’s ID in client.java, then edit anything relating to the special gfx to some random other numbers.

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Bow Special
item.dc:creator: @ProjectInfinity ProjectInfinity
item.description:
@ProjectInfinity wrote:

0.o one of the best coders ever asking a question AMAZING TOO ME!
BUMP
and i think it has to do with what GFX you call for under the spec, so search for your dbow id, and find setgfx or whateva and find dbow and add that ;S hope i helped

Read full topic

item.title: Dark Bow Special
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

Change the

projectilespec(###)

= Gfx it’s using to shoot the d-mace. Find out what a good spec looks like.

And btw. It’s a d-mace because, on some clients, d-maces look like d-bow specs in your inventories.
This is why. It’s either your client, or you just have some bad luck.

Read full topic
